title: UEFA fine Barca, St Etienne
text:
Barcelona and St Etienne fined by UEFA for fans misbehaviour Last Updated: 23/03/17 5:23pm Barcelona players celebrate their historic victory over PSG Barcelona and Saint-Etienne have been fined by UEFA for their fans' behaviour in recent Champions League and Europa League ties. 
Barcelona have been hit with a £16,000 bill from European football's governing body in respect of the pitch invasion that followed their 6-1 Champions League victory against Paris Saint-Germain at the Nou Camp on March 8. Upgrade to Sky Sports now and get 12 months for just £18 per month! 
Supporters entered the field of play after substitute Sergi Roberto scored a dramatic winner with almost the last kick of the second-leg match to secure an improbable comeback. 
Meanwhile, St-Etienne have been hit with a £43,000 sanction after their fans set off fireworks and threw objects during their Europa League match against Manchester United at Old Trafford on February 16. Saint-Etienne have been fined after their fans set off fireworks at Old Trafford
